intro: Humboltia scabripes, commonly known as the roughleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coast, where it thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Humboltia scabripes is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important role in coastal ecosystems.
